thread.title: Acute herpes zoster and post herpetic neuralgia in primary care: a study of diagnosis, treatment and cost
thread.title_full: Acute herpes zoster and post herpetic neuralgia in primary care: a study of diagnosis, treatment and cost

posts.author: Αλέξανδρος Σφακιανάκης (noreply@blogger.com)
posts.title: Acute herpes zoster and post herpetic neuralgia in primary care: a study of diagnosis, treatment and cost
posts.text:
Abstract Acute herpes zoster and its complication post herpetic neuralgia represent a significant challenge to primary care physicians in their care of an ageing population of patients. This was a cross-sectional observational study by means of a quantitative survey of 1,000 general practitioners registered in Ireland exploring the frequency of diagnosis, methods of treatment and cost of AHZ and PHN in primary care. We recorded an 18% response rate ( n  = 184) with an 83% completion rate ( n  = 152/184). 80% of cases of AHZ occurred in patients aged 50 years or more with 81% of study participants encountering cases at a rate of 1–3 patients per month. Famciclovir (37%) and valaciclovir (36%) were the most commonly prescribed antiviral agents. Mild opioids (32%) were the most common analgesic agents used for first line AHZ pain, and pregabalin (37%) the most commonly prescribed analgesic agent for second line AHZ pain. Pregabalin was also the most commonly prescribed analgesic for both first and second line PHN pain (29% and 24%, respectively). The mean per-case direct cost (medication and GP visits) of treating AHZ and PHN in primary care was €195 (range €153–€236) and €201 (range €140–€313), respectively. Based on national sentinel data the estimated annual direct costs of treating AHZ and PHN in primary care is €2,278,196 (range €1,793,399–€2, 763,445). The treatment of AHZ and PHN represents both a significant care and cost burden on primary care resources in Ireland in keeping with other European based studies.

http://ift.tt/2AEd7yV

posts.author: Reuters
posts.title: FOREX-Dollar rebounds vs yen, bitcoin surges above $14,000
posts.text:
Shutterstock photo
* Dollar/yen sheds losses as equities rebound
* Underlying optimism on US tax reform supports dollar
* Bitcoin tops record $14,000
* Graphic: World FX rates in 2017 http://tmsnrt.rs/2egbfVh
By Jemima Kelly
LONDON, Dec 7 (Reuters) - The dollar recovered some ground against the yen on Thursday, as global markets regained some appetite for risk, and on optimism that the United States will successfully push through a tax reform programme.
The greenback had slipped against the safe-haven Japanese currency on Wednesday after U.S. President Donald Trump said he would recognise Jerusalem as the capital of Israel -- a move that imperiled Middle East peace efforts and provoked widespread condemnation. urn:newsml:reuters.com:*:nL8N1O66E1
But as global stock prices rebounded on Thursday, investors bought back into the U.S. currency, which was trading up 0.3 percent on the day at 112.60 yenJPY= .
Against a basket of six major currencies, the dollar hit a two-week high .DXY .
U.S. Senate Republicans agreed to talks with the House of Representatives on sweeping tax legislation on Wednesday, amid early signs that lawmakers could bridge their differences and agree on a final bill ahead of a self-imposed Dec. 22 deadline. urn:newsml:reuters.com:*:nL1N1O61VT
"The dollar is fighting back a little bit but there's still some caution, as it could still be a few weeks until we know the oucome of the tax reform bill," said Rabobank currency strategist Jane Foley, in London.
"The yen will be sensitive if geopolitical tensions rise again, and I think there's an inevitability to that, so I don't think there's going to be too much updside for dollar/yen in this environment," she added.
Upbeat U.S. private-sector employment data released on Wednesday also provided some support to the dollar. But strategists said the currency would trade in narrow ranges until the release of the closely watched non-farm payrolls report on Friday.
The move higher in dollar/yen came amid a surge in Tokyo shares, which had slumped the previous day on Middle East concerns.
But considering the Nikkei's .N225 gains - the index was up almost 1.5 percent - the dollar's rise versus the yen appeared limited, some observers noted.
"The decoupling that has begun taking place between equities and currencies is one of the key market themes of 2017," said Daisuke Karakama, chief market economist at Mizuho Bank.
The euro inched down a touch to $1.1792EUR= after hitting a two-week low of $1.1780 on Wednesday.
Bitcoin soared to a record high of more than $14,500, up almost 7 percent on the day and continuing a staggering surge from less than $1,000 at the beginning of the year.
The Canadian dollar added to losses suffered on Wednesday after the Bank of Canada held interest rates steady and showed enough caution to dampen expectations for a hike early next year. CAD/
The loonie was 0.3 percent down on the day at a six-day low of C$1.2835 per U.S. dollar CAD=D4 .
(Reporting by Jemima Kelly; Editing by Angus MacSwan) (( jemima.kelly@thomsonreuters.com ; +44)(0)(20 7542 7508; Reuters Messaging: jemima.kelly.thomsonreuters@reuters.net ))
Keywords: GLOBAL FOREX/

I wasn't going to come forward. Then I was. Then I wasn't. I've been hoping Franken would just step down and I wouldn't have to say anything. I've been hoping he's a decent enough man not to force his victims to parade in front of the Ethics Committee. I've been hoping I'd not ever have the moniker of "Franken accuser."

I don't know his full reasoning behind why he wants an ethics investigation, but any sane person that is against sexual harassment, assault or rape of someone of power should demand an ethics investigation. Yes, it will be hard on the victims, and since she is a Democrat that is accusing another Democrat, while knowing that a President that has been accused of worse than Franken, and a possible senator from Alabama that has a thing for going after underage girls; you would think she would be ok with talking to an ethics investigation.

I believe her, but an ethics investigation isn't about parading the victims, it is about letting them speak, and to force a standard for all politicians to get investigated if they get accused of anything ...

I don't think the people that were looking into Moore were trying to bad talk him, they just wanted to get information about it him, and it uncovered dirt. Yet, one side is still defending two people accused of sexual assault of a minor. That side doesn't want Franken investigated, because then they will have to be investigated as well.
That is what the woman from the Atlantic article bothers me more than Tweeden, or the others accusers of Fraken. Tweeden has an agenda, but the Atlantic writer, acted like she was this saint, because she was a Democrat, but at the same time self hating. She defended Bill Clinton, but then decides he is a rapist, because she was grabbed by the butt by Franken. If Kenneth Starr didn't use that as ammo about Bill, it probably wasn't legit enough to use.
She wants to call Franken out, but doesn't want him to be investigated for it, because it parades the victims. I get that Democrats have real expectations towards their own, if you rape, GTFO, but you are being hypocritical for not wanting someone investigated that wants to be investigated. Lady, you just don't want to go up to an ethics committee for whatever reason. Stop self hating, because there are some shiatty people in your party, do the right thing get everything looked into, so people that you don't like can be held to the same standards as the people that broke your heart.

thread.title: Stanmore residents evacuated as 'really big flames' break out in back garden
thread.title_full: Stanmore residents evacuated as 'really big flames' break out in back garden

posts.author: Goolistan Cooper
posts.title: Stanmore residents evacuated as 'really big flames' break out in back garden
posts.text:
News Stanmore residents evacuated as 'really big flames' break out in back garden Residents were evacuated from their properties in Woodlands Drive due to a large garden fire on Tuesday (December 5) Share Click   Get   
People living in a Stanmore road were told to leave their properties after a huge fire broke out in a back garden. 
Firefighters and police were called to Woodlands Drive just before 6.30pm on Tuesday (December 5) evening to reports of large flames coming from the rear garden. 
Police say the fire started in a shed and quickly spread to a residential garage. 
Jenner Folwell lives nearby on Kenton Drive and says he saw flames spread to a nearby tree. Read More Horror crash outside fire station 
He realised something was wrong when his dog started barking in the back garden. 
Speaking to getwestlondon , he said: “I had a look and saw the flames, they were really big. Then I saw a tree start to catch fire. Thick smoke was seen coming from the flames (Image: Jenner Folwell) 
“I called 999 and was told they had received a few calls about it already.” 
He said the fire was quickly brought under control once firefighters were at the scene, saying the flames were extinguished within about 30 minutes of their arrival. Large flames seen coming from the back garden of a property in Stanmore (Image: Jenner Folwell) 
Shortly after he received a knock at the door as his property backs on to the fire-affected garden. 
“It was a policeman, he asked if we could evacuate the house," Mr Folwell said. 
"I explained to him that we couldn’t, and he told us to stay away from the back window.” Police asked residents to leave their homes on Tuesday (December 5) evening (Image: Jenner Folwell) 
Police say residents were evacuated but allowed back to their homes a short while later. 
No one was injured.

thread.title: Honor 7X : Hardy phone with dashing disposition
thread.title_full: Honor 7X : Hardy phone with dashing disposition

posts.author: samadwhatsapp
posts.title: Honor 7X : Hardy phone with dashing disposition
posts.text:
Honor 7X : Hardy phone with dashing disposition December 7, 2017 , 2:46 PM IST 
New Delhi: At a time when prices of premium smartphones are soaring sky-high, some smartphone makers are finding ways to pack an ensemble of enviable features including dual camera technology into their mid-range variants as well. But what are most of these mid-range phones missing on? The style quotient is definitely one. Huawei’s youth-centric sub-brand Honor seems to be keen on filling this gap with the launch of its Honor 7X smartphone – the successor to its quite successful 6X variant. Drop and break? #Honor7X can keep you away from the trouble. Check it out what George did. #MaxYourView #Maxout Know more about #Honor7X : https://t.co/wCY8RZ4Osh pic.twitter.com/HJ9cA068LL 
— Honor Smartphone (@Honorglobal) December 6, 2017 
The 4GB RAM Honor 7X, launched for the Indian market at an event in London this week, won’t cost you a fortune – a maximum of Rs 12,999 or Rs 15,999, depending on the variant you choose from the two on offer — and yet it could well make you want to display the phone in front of friends or foes with a sense of pride. 
This is because of the taller-than-wider frame of the device and almost edge-to-edge display that give it a premium look. It looks like the smaller sibling of the premium Honor 8 Pro from the rear. 
The metal unibody design and bigger body-to-screen ratio add to the dashing look. 
So much for the appearance. Let’s see what works for the phone and what does not. 
One big plus is its big screen and a full-HD+ display. The importance of a 5.93-inch screen is not skin deep, as heavy users of smartphones would know. 
Also Read : 6GB Honor V10 with AI-enabled coming to India in January 
With 18:9 aspect ratio, which is hardly available on a phone below Rs 15,000, and “Full View” HD+ display, Honor 7X ensures enriching video viewing experience. This is something gamers would also like as they get an edge of a wider view of the plot. 
Powered by the 2.36GHz octa-core “Kirin 659” processor, the device runs Android 7.0 Nougat operating system (OS) with the company’s custom EMUI 5.1 running on top. 
The pricing differentiator of the two variants is the internal storage. The 32GB variant costs Rs 3,000 less than the 64GB variant. But both variants provide the option of expanding memory up to 256GB via hybrid micro-SD card slots. 
A big screen and better display would favour long hours of use. But does the battery of the phone back it up? The 3,340mAh battery does a good job in this regard. With 7X, light to moderate users do not even need to charge the phone every day. 
In comparison, Xiaomi’s Mi A1, which is also a 4GB RAM phone with 64GB onboard storage, packs a smaller 3,080mAh battery. 
The Honor 7X has also equipped its cameras with fun and useful features. Clicking a selfie with this phone is all the more easier as its 8MP front camera comes with a gesture control which means you simply have to turn your palm to the camera to trigger a countdown to click a selfie. 
The dual-lens 16MP + 2MP primary camera captures images in great detail and depth. It allows you to take pictures in wide-aperture mode, portrait mode, and even to click a moving picture, a feature that we first saw in iPhone 6S. 
The pictures also snap colours in their vivid glories. 
What makes this dual rear camera stand out is its “Phase Detection Auto Focus” (PDAF) technology which offers ultra-fast focus time, making it easier to take pictures in fleeting moments. 
The eye-comfort mode filters out blue light to help relieve visual fatigue. This feature makes reading books on the phone a delight. 
What does not work for the phone? 
Despite the fancy features on its cameras, the photos come out grainy in low-light conditions, especially with the front shooter. 
Surprisingly, the device uses the older micro USB 2.0 connector rather than the newer USB Type-C. 
And thanks to its size, some may even find it difficult to navigate the phone with one hand. 
Conclusion: Overall, we feel that Honor 7X is a hardy phone with dashing disposition and has the potential to give mid-range phones of other Chinese players, such as Xiaomi and Motorola, a stiff competition. It offers a big screen bonanza for affordable smartphone seekers. 
— IANS

Murkanen : TuteTibiImperes: WhoIsWillo: TuteTibiImperes: Maybe they do, along with the male Democrats calling for the same. Instead of tripping over each other running away afraid that they might get lumped in with Franken I'd like to see them stand beside him and fight to preserve/restore his reputation.
He had a chance. He could have admitted to a pattern of behavior when the first allegation came out. He didn't--but he also indicated that we should expect additional stories when the first allegation was revealed. He has not done anything so far since the photographic evidence of his actions was revealed to earn any benefit of the doubt, and those defending him for political expedience make me ill.
Goodbye.
I don't recall any such indication, and all that photograph showed was a poor attempt at humor with hands hovering over body-armor clad breasts.
I feel the same way about those willing to vilify the man over accusations that look more baseless and/or like premeditated political hits the more you look into them.
The latest is a woman who claims that Franken putting his arm around her side in a photo she demanded of him was sexual assault because "I don't even let my husband touch me that way".
The picture had her arm around the back of his neck and on his shoulder, so the choices were the small of the back (awkward and a risk of butt bumping if you misjudge where the back ends and ass begins), hanging limply (and chancing it bump into her ass anyway), or her hip. And her justification for "coming forward"? She didn't want an ethics investigation to go forward into the allegations being made against Franken. She flatly stated that cratering it was her goal.
Yikes, I just read that piece. She believes a man putting his hand around her waist diminishes her as a professional woman? She comes across as a raving loon.
You're not that special. None of us are that special. Making such a big deal about someone's hand briefly being somewhere you'd rather it not be implies a level of self-centered delusion that I can't really understand.
 How does claptrap like that even get published?

GoldSpider : Murkanen: GoldSpider:
No, we have to prove how morally superior we are to them by acting just like them!
Franken asked for an ethics investigation into his behaviour. Republicans wrote character references to keep Dennis Hastert out of prison when it became public knowledge that he raped children.
Shut the fark up with your "Both sides" bullshiat.
There have been other accusations since Franken's apology, and they've evidently made an impact on a number of Democratic senators.
But be mad at me, and be mad at the people who want to hold the party to a higher standard. That makes you about as thoughtful and patriotic as the average Trump voter.
I'll preface this by stating that I don't believe Franken has intentionally groped or sexually assaulted any women, but holding yourself to a higher standard means nothing if it doesn't win more seats.
If the Trump voters aren't going to turn on theirs for indiscretions, drawing a line in the sand over what we won't accept in our own elected officials leads to the ousting of powerful voices without reciprocity on the other side, and taking that moral stance doesn't lead to more Democrats being elected, it's not the right move.
It doesn't matter how pure the party can say it is if it doesn't win enough seats to take control and actually pass legislation. Everything should be a means to that end. You want stronger protection for women in the workplace? You want the police to kill fewer unarmed black people? You want the EPA to stop companies from destroying the environment to make a buck? You want the FCC to act in the best interests of consumers instead of mega-telecoms? To do that you have to take control of the legislature and the White House, nothing else matters until that happens.
The moral high ground doesn't mean jack unless it leads to more votes, and thus far there hasn't been a strong correlation there. Win and you get to do some good by pushing your agenda. Everything should be looked at in the light of 'will this help or hurt our chances of taking control of Congress and the White House'.

thread.title: Alan Judge targets Brentford return over Christmas and vows to be an improved player
thread.title_full: Alan Judge targets Brentford return over Christmas and vows to be an improved player

posts.author: Tom Moore
posts.title: Alan Judge targets Brentford return over Christmas and vows to be an improved player
posts.text:
Sport Alan Judge targets Brentford return over Christmas and vows to be an improved player The Irishman kicked a ball in anger for the first time in 605 days on Tuesday when he played for Brentford B against Barnet, marking his return with a goal after 10 minutes Share   
Alan Judge is targeting a return to the Brentford first team over the Christmas period but doesn't want a sympathy call. 
The Irishman kicked a ball in anger for the first time in 605 days on Tuesday when he played for Brentford B against Barnet, marking his return with a goal after 10 minutes. 
Dean Smith will want him to get as close to 90 minutes as possible before considering him for first team action, having done so with Lewis Macleod who made his return from an anterior cruciate ligament in Saturday's 3-1 win over Fulham. 
And Judge does not want to make just one cameo appearance; he wants to make an impact. 
He told the Irish Sun: “It felt good. It was just a matter of getting through it and I’ll get a few more games in the next two or three weeks and see where we are. Alan Judge goes for goal (Image: Paul Burgman) 
“Playing over Christmas might be a possibility but I don’t want to be in the squad out of sympathy or to make a cameo appearance. I want to be there because I can make an impact.” 
It has been nearly 20 months since Judge made an appearance for the first team and he has been using his absence to improve his body, insisting he is in better shape than ever. 
He said: “When I had the first op, I was told a year but from the first day of rehab when they put a towel under my foot for me to try to scrunch my toes together, having not moved for two or three weeks, I knew it was going to be a long process. 
“I’d really wanted to get back last season but deep down I knew I wasn’t going to be 100 per cent and I ended up having the second op. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now 
“It was a bit of a setback but I wanted to get it right. And I am physically stronger and better than I have ever been. The way I am feeling now, I definitely feel as though I can play for longer than maybe I expected to, bar injury of course. 
“And, although I have obviously had a very serious injury, I am not an injury-prone player so I am optimistic. 
“One thing I had always wanted to work on was my leg strength and that has improved massively. I spent a lot of time with the sports science and strength and conditioning people and they’ve had me on a great programme. 
“When you are playing in the Championship, you don’t get that time to work on those things. If you’re playing Tuesday, Saturday, Tuesday for two or three weeks, you don’t have time to train, let alone anything else. So I definitely think I will be better in that regard. 
“It might take me a while to get the sharpness back but I’m sure people will be understanding about that given how long I have been out for.” Like us on Facebook

I abhor Republican political positions, but I have to respect the hell out of their strategy. They've perfected the art of electoral sabermetrics. The goals and platform are what matter, the strategy to get there is irrelevant as long as we get there. If we want to have a chance to enact the things we believe in we have to win first.
I'll support the party wants to legislate and enact the laws and regulations that I believe will make the country better. How we get to the point of being able to do that doesn't matter to me.

Your mom is a smart, strong woman. Please give her a totally innocent platonic not-at-all harassy hug/handshake from me.
